body_html:
As I said in your previous issue .to returns new tensors, so you need to re-assign results of these two lines

        lp07.to(device)
        lp14.to(device)

thanks for answering my question. i figure out it by modify my code:
lp07 = lp07.to(device) lp14 = lp14.to(device)
but i don't know why should i do this. In pytorch 0.3.0, the tensor just use:
tensor.cuda()
body_text:
As I said in your previous issue .to returns new tensors, so you need to re-assign results of these two lines
        lp07.to(device)
        lp14.to(device)


thanks for answering my question. i figure out it by modify my code:
lp07 = lp07.to(device) lp14 = lp14.to(device)
but i don't know why should i do this. In pytorch 0.3.0, the tensor just use:
tensor.cuda()
body:
> As I said in your previous issue `.to` returns new tensors, so you need to re-assign results of these two lines
> 
> ```
>         lp07.to(device)
>         lp14.to(device)
> ```
thanks for answering my question. i figure out it by modify my code:
`
            lp07 = lp07.to(device)
            lp14 = lp14.to(device)
`
but i don't know why should i do this. In pytorch 0.3.0, the tensor just use:
`tensor.cuda()`
